name: Sahara Star Hotel

reviews.text: Approaching the hotel one might think to be entering a construction site as the outside of the site is not finished yet. After friendly check in I went to my room and was stunned by firstly the luxury in general, then the abundant technical gadgets in the room, the stylish bathroom and rest of the room, but ultimately when opening the curtains and viewing the inside of the hotel from my balcony. The view is a huge indoor arena with a lagoon and tropical garden in the centre with various lounges and live orchestra. There is nothing that reminds you that Bombay is just outside. I have never seen something similar. As it was late and I was tired from a long haul flight, I nevertheless tried to sleep and would suggest ear-plugs as the entertainment although not exaggerated still is perceivable through the closed balcony door. On the balcony by the way it is permitted to smoke what I appreciated. After few hours of sleep I took breakfast at the cafe. Good quality, note also the amazing aquarium there. A day later I had dinner at the Indian restaurant, and it was absolutely excellent (took Aloo Gobi, chicken, lamb, lentils). What was positive: the room was fully equipped with everything I appreciate including coffee maker, complimentary mineral water, ironing board, large flat screen TV with BBC World and CNN, slippers, etc. but it takes about one hour to get acquainted with all the gadgets, by the way all worked. Laundry service very efficient, my washing picked up within few minutes and returned on time well done. The newspaper Times of India delivered early morning. Positive is also a smokers lounge (Diwine) just at the ground floor café. What I missed at the hotel was any reference to India and/or the local Bombay culture, except the Indian restaurant and of course the personnel that was friendly and helpful without exception. As my time was limited, I couldn't visit all of the hotel (e.g. business centre, swimming pool, shops, etc.) , so maybe next time. Forgot to mention free of charge! pick up at airport with large name board at arrival and water offered in car. Also transfer back to airport on time and also free of charge, remember to be at airport at least two hours before departure due to extremely long queues. To conclude, I can recommend this hotel to everyone who appreciates full service, modern infrastructure and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Bombay Inside Out

reviews.text: The hotel takes you by surprise by the mere grandeur of space. The rooms are extremely spacious and the balcony attached to the rooms is definitely the best part. Just chill over a cup of coffee in your balcony and you will feel totally relaxed..its in the city yet away from it...

Amazingly designed with lovely views all around. the Ocean restaurant allows you to have Oriental cuisine right next to the aquarium- which is apparently one of the biggest aquariums in India. You will never have a dull moment here.

reviews.text: Sahara Star is one of the best hotels i have visited. Being a resident of Mumbai, I didn't stay at any of the rooms, but visited their restaurants and also had occasions celebrated here. Their Sahara pranam is very welcoming; it gives one a cordial feeling. We recently celebrated a christening party at Sahara Star which was very well-organised. The mouth-watering delicacies and rhythmic tracks made for a tremendous celebration. The restaurants are also one of the best in the city and provide a wide range of delicacies. The ambience of the place is simply outstanding. I would say, it’s designed to perfection and is well-maintained. The hotel's magnificence blended with Indian culture symbolises hospitality and stands deeply rooted in the varied traditions of India. Strategically located near Mumbai's domestic airport, Sahara Star provides unmatched experience when it comes to service.
reviews.title: Just perfect!

reviews.text: A very nice hotel from the in-side. The place is still going extensive renovation but it does not effect the current property and rooms. Very good dining options from the Indian Restaurant / Kebab Place / Coffee Shop / Mediterranean Cusine. I love the morning breakfast spread. Its almost infinite. Very courteous staff, Nice rooms great location for some catching early morning flight as Bombay traffic is bad.

reviews.title: A hotel for the 21st century

reviews.text: I visited the restaurants at the Sahara Star, on the recommendation of a colleague. I was staying at a different hotel nearby, so I can't comment on the hotel aspect, but the concept is amazing: all the hotel rooms look out over the oasis in the middle, which is covered by a tent roof. The air is cooled to the perfect level of temperature and humidity. The elevators know how to look sexy when they're not being used (they've been made into a feature rather than a function). The restaurants are all built around this lagoon, or oasis, and there are trees, plants, water features and a laser show. If I were staying in Mumbai again, this would be high on my list of places to stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff and lovely relaxed hotel
